items.name: Wikibench
items.description: Wikibench provides tools for AI deployed in community contexts, addressing the limitations of datasets created without community input.

items.name: Connected Experience Lab (CoEx Lab)
items.description: Focused on designing interactive systems to empower users to communicate and analyze data more effectively.

items.name: Jigsaw: Supporting Designers to Prototype Multimodal Applications
items.description: TThis project helps designers assemble AI models for multimodal applications, enabling them to combine language, vision, and other modalities.

items.name: Voice Pilot Framework
items.description: The VoicePilot project at Carnegie Mellon University develops a speech interface for physically assistive robots, enhancing communication through large language models (LLMs). The framework enables personalized and robust voice commands, improving care for individuals with motor impairments. Tested on the Obi assistive feeding robot, the study established five guidelines for effective speech integration in assistive technology.

items.name: Eye into AI
items.description: A novel approach using games to evaluate explainable AI (XAI) techniques by gathering human feedback on model transparency.

items.name: Future Interfaces Group (FIG)
items.description: FIG creates new interface technologies for immersive environments, including wearables and smart environments.

items.name: Predicting and Visualizing Overdose Risk for Public Health
items.description: This project uses machine learning to predict opioid overdose risks, aiding public health efforts with data visualization tools.

items.name: d.form and d.stable Labs
items.description: This lab explores human-AI interaction by developing prototypes for emerging technologies like smart environments and robots.
